meanings.definition: An act or instance of being rude or impolite.
meanings.sent1: His discourtesy in not holding the door open for the elderly lady was disappointing.
meanings.sent2: The discourtesy of talking loudly in the library disturbed the other patrons.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel showed discourtesy by stealing all the birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The discourtesy of ignoring someone's feelings can hurt them deeply.
meanings.sent5: The discourtesy of cutting in line angered the other waiting customers.
